Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: New Year's flask
Description: New Year's flask with a globular body, pointed bottom and a small narrowed neck ending in a protruding lip. Two small handles have been attached at the top of the neck and to the top of the body. There are remains of a geometrical pattern comprised of four parallel horizontal stripes on the upper section of the body.
